Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
On 6/18/22, youth was attacking and biting a staff member. Staff member had their
knee on youth's head or neck area. Staff member used their arm to push against
2

youth's forehead to get them to release their bite. Youth has an abrasion on the back
and shoulder blades. Youth also has a mark on the forehead between the eyebrows.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported he was restrained in the
gym parking lot by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. Youth A reported on the way back to
the facility from swimming, Staff 1 made a comment about seeing an older person
on the side of the road and stated it was Youth A in 30 years. Youth A was upset
about this comment as he felt Staff 1 was saying he was going to be a homeless
person in 30 years. Youth A reported upon arriving back to the facility he went into
the house and filled his water bottle and got his shower bag to go to the gym for
showers. Youth A reported he walked out of Wilcox house to go to the gym to
shower and Staff 1 was following him and telling him to make the right choice.
Youth A reported he turned around to Staff 1 and told him that he was right there,
and they could fight it out. Youth A reported he raised his arms to Staff 1 and Staff 1
flinched. Youth A reported Staff 1 attempted to restrain him. Youth A reported Staff
1 attempted to put him in a standing restraint by grabbing Youth A’s arms. Youth A
reported he pulled away from Staff 1 and then Staff 2 assisted. Youth A reported he,
Staff 1, and Staff 2 fell to the ground. Youth A reported he was unsure how or why
they fell to the ground. Youth A reported he was lying flat on his back and Staff 1
had his left arm, Staff 2 had his right arm and Staff 3 came and assisted and had his
legs. Youth A reported he blacked out at times and was unable to recall where Staff
1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 were holding him in the restraint. Youth A reported Staff 1 put
his knee on Youth A’s neck. Youth A reported Staff 3 was telling Staff 1 to move his
knee off Youth A’s neck. Youth A reported he was unsure how long Staff 1’s knee
was on his neck. Youth A reported Staff 1 punched him under the chin. Youth A
reported he bit Staff 1’s arm. Youth A reported Staff 1 punched him again in the
right cheek. Youth A reported Staff 1 was pushing his face into the ground. Youth A
reported he was able to get his left arm free from Staff 1 and was trying to push Staff
1 off him. Youth A reported he blacked out again at this point. Youth A reported the
restraint lasted about 6-8 minutes. Youth A reported Staff 4 came and switched
Staff 1 out of the restraint. Youth A reported he was calm after Staff 1 was out of the
restraint and was released from the restraint. Youth A reported he had scratches on
his back from the concrete parking lot that he was restrained on. Youth A reported
the scratches were cleaned with peroxide. Youth A reported he does not like Staff 1
due to the comments Staff 1 makes and his attitude. Youth A reported no concerns
with Staff 2 or Staff 3 regarding the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and again by this consultant via telephone on 7/22/2022.
Staff 1 reported youth and staff had gone swimming and there is a no splashing rule.
Youth A was splashing and was given three warnings and then was told by Staff 1 to
3

get out of the pool. On the way back to the facility Staff 1 was stopped at a stop sign
and saw a car with a driver that looked like Youth A. Staff 1 reported he said there is
Youth A in 10 years. Staff 1 reported he did not mean anything negative by this as
the driver resembled Youth A. Staff 1 reported later he learned that Youth A thought
he was referring to a homeless individual which upset Youth A. Staff 1 reported upon
returning to the facility Youth A ran into the house and was told to wait for staff.
Youth A got his shower bag. Staff 1 reported he could tell Youth A was upset and
requested Youth A talk to the on-call administrator via telephone prior to taking a
shower. Staff 1 reported Youth A walked out of the house. Staff 1 followed Youth A
and asked Youth A what was wrong. Staff 1 reported Youth A began swearing and
threw his shower bag to the ground. Youth A then turned to Staff 1 who was
approximately 6 feet behind him and asked Staff 1 if Staff 1 wanted to “catch these
hands” referring to fighting. Youth A then flinched at Staff 1 like he was going to hit
him as Youth A had his hands up to his chest in fists. Staff 1 reported he engaged in
a Safe Crisis Management standing torso hold and described this per the model
technique. Staff 1 reported Youth A grabbed him around the waist resulting in him
not being able to secure Youth A in the hold. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 came to assist
and Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 1 reported Youth A fell on
his side, Staff 1 reported he had Youth A’s left arm and Staff 2 had Youth A’s right
arm. Staff 1 reported Youth A was resisting and shifting his body weight causing the
three to fall to the ground. Staff 1 reported once they were on the ground that he
was in a squatting position, and he attempted to get into a kneeling position on both
knees. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 assisted with Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 reported Youth
A was in a Safe Crisis Management Supine Extension Assist hold and explained per
the model hold. Staff 1 reported Youth A was moving his head on the ground from
side to side and when Staff 1 went to reposition his knee, he placed his knee on
Youth A’s ear for a second. Staff 1 reported he did not have any body weight on
Youth A’s ear. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 told him to move his knee from Youth A’s ear.
Staff 1 reported he moved his knee. Staff 1 reported Youth A began spitting and
then bit Staff 1’s bicep. Staff 1 reported he was unable to feed the bit as trained in
the Safe Crisis Management Model due to the angle he was at. Staff 1 reported he
was unable to use the key lock method that is trained in the Safe Crisis Management
Model as he was holding Youth A’s arms with his hands. Staff 1 reported he used
his forearm and hit Youth A’s jaw to get Youth A to release. Staff 1 reported there
was blood dripping down his arm. Youth A released from the bit after Staff 1 used
his forearm to hit Youth A in the jaw. Staff 1 reported using his forearm to hit Youth
A’s jaw is not a Safe Crisis Management method to use for bits. Staff 1 reported
Staff 4 came and switched him out of the restraint due to him bleeding. Staff 1
reported he went into the house to clean up the blood. Staff 1 reported he has since
received additional training on what to do when balance is thrown off in a restraint as
well as additional training on Safe Crisis Management bite releases. Staff 1 reported
he felt a serious threat of violence and injury if he did not restraint Youth A, as Youth
A’s fists were a foot away from his face. Youth A was trying to hurt Staff 1 as Staff 1
indicated Youth A verbalized, he was going to hit him and was in a fighting stance.
Staff 1 reported Youth A did not swing to hit him prior to Staff 1 engaging in the
restraint. Staff 1 initiated the restraint to prevent Youth A from hitting him. Youth A
4

has assaulted staff previously however Staff 1 did not know any specifics regarding
the incidents. Staff 1 reported he has been hit by numerous youth in the past and
has not sustained any serious injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported he was on the porch of the Wilcox home.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was getting agitated and threw his shower bag on the
ground and was yelling and puffing his chest to Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was flinching towards Staff 1 like he was going to hit him and making verbal threats
that he was going to fight Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 initiated a standing upper
torso restraint from the back. Staff 2 reported Youth A wrapped his arms around
Staff 1’s waist. Staff 2 assisted by securing Youth A’s right arm. Youth A struggled
and pulled which caused Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2 to lose balance and fall to the
ground. Staff 2 reported maintaining hold of Youth A as well as Staff 1 remaining
hold of Youth A and breaking Youth A’s fall. Staff 2 reported once Youth A was on
the ground, he began kicking his legs and Staff 3 came to assist to secure Youth A’s
legs. Staff 2 described Youth A being in a supine extended arm hold. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 was in an awkward squatted position from the fall and was trying to
get his body moved to have his right leg out and his left leg bent. Staff 2 reported he
and Staff 1 were holding Youth A’s wrist and upper arm to secure per the Safe Crisis
Management model. Staff 2 reported Youth A began biting Staff 1 approximately 30
seconds to a minute of being on the ground in the restraint. Staff 2 reported he
heard a knock sound which he stated he thought to be a hit but did not see what
occurred. Staff 2 reported he noticed Youth A was no longer biting Staff 1. Staff 2
reported he did not recall if Staff 1 said anything. Staff 2 reported Staff 1’s arm was
bleeding from where Youth A bit him. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was trying to adjust his
legs during the restraint while he was still in the squatted position and his knee hit
Youth A’s head. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 moved his knee right away. Staff 2
reported Youth A was continuing to struggle in the restraint. Staff 2 reported staff are
trained to stuff the area being bitten into the biters mouth so the bitter can’t bite
harder and to place a hand on the biter’s forehead. Staff 2 reported he did not see
Staff 1 punch Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 told him he used his elbow to hit
Youth A to get Youth A to release from biting him. Staff 2 reported he did not see
this occur. Staff 2 reported he did not see any injuries on Youth A’s face. Staff 2
reported approximately 5 minutes into the restraint Staff 4 came and switched Staff 1
out of the restraint. Staff 2 reported he did not think Youth A saw the nurse Saturday
night however he believed he saw the nurse on Sunday for the cuts on his back from
the concrete where he was restrained. Staff 2 reported he has not been in any
restraints prior with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported he had no concerns with Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported he was in the house when a youth ran in and
told him there was a restraint. Staff 3 reported he went out and saw Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Youth A falling to the ground. Staff 3 reported Youth A was fighting to get out
and Staff 2 lost balance and fell on his back. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 tried to catch
Youth A and himself. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 maintained holds on Youth
5

A’s arms and were attempting to get into a Safe Crisis Management hold. Staff 3
described a supine extended arm hold. Youth A was moving his arms and kicking
his legs trying to shove Staff 1 and Staff 2 off him. Staff 3 reported he secured
Youth A’s legs and was facing towards Youth A. Staff 3 reported he had to change
positions and face away from Youth A due to Youth A moving so much. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 was in an awkward position and Staff 1’s knee went down on Youth
A’s ear for a second. Staff 3 reported he saw this and told Staff 1 not to do that and
to readjust. Staff 3 reported he did not see Youth A bite Staff 1. Staff 3 reported he
heard Staff 1 moving his hand trying to hold Youth A’s arms. Staff 3 reported later
Staff 1 told him that he used his forearm to hit Youth A in the jaw to get him to
release the bite. Staff 3 reported Youth A was saying Staff 1 hit him. Staff 3 reported
he did not see any bruising on Youth A’s face. Staff 3 reported Youth A had a
scrape by his eyebrow and was unsure how he got it. Staff 3 reported staff are
trained to feed bites and use their knuckles on the jaw to get a youth to release from
a bite. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was bleeding from the bite. Staff 3 was unaware of
Staff 1 punching Youth A. Staff 3 reported a few minutes into the restraint Staff 4
transitioned Staff 1 out of the restraint. Staff 3 reported Youth A calmed down right
away and was released. Staff 3 reported Youth A refused medical treatment for the
scrapes on his back and eyebrow. Staff 3 reported this was the first restraint that he
has been in. Staff 3 reported the youth like Staff 1 a lot and that he has no concerns
with Staff 1.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 6/28/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Staff 4 reported he received a call about a restraint outside the gym and
went to assist. Staff 4 reported when he got outside by the gym, he assessed the
situation and noticed that Youth A was angry towards Staff 1 as Youth A was yelling
at Staff 1. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 was securing Youth A’s right arm and Staff 1’s legs
were positioned towards Youth A’s arm pit with Youth A’s arm over Staff 4’s legs.
Staff 4 reported Staff 2 had Youth A’s arm secured the same way and Staff 3 had
Youth A’s legs secured in a supine position. Staff 4 reported he had no concerns
with the hold that he assessed. Staff 4 reported he transitioned Staff 1 out of the
restraint and Youth A quickly calmed down. Staff 4 reported upon transitioning into
the restraint he advised Staff 2 to reposition, so he and Staff 2 had Youth A’s arms
secured on the ground in an extended supine Safe Crisis Management hold. Staff 4
reported he felt safer having Youth A’s arms secured on the ground verses over his
legs as this limited his movement more. Staff 4 reported Youth A quickly calmed
down and he made a plan to release Youth A. Staff 4 reported Youth A had a small
cut near his eyebrow. Staff 4 did not know where the injury came from. Staff 4
reported when Youth A went to shower, he noticed the scrapes on his back from the
pavement. Staff 4 reported he did not notice Staff 1 bleeding during the restraint
however noticed after. Staff 4 reported after the restraint Youth A told Administrator
2 that Staff 1 punched him and then was stating that Staff 1 elbowed him. Staff 4
reported Youth A was inconsistent on whether he was punched or elbowed. Staff 4
reported he did not see any injuries on Youth A’s face. Staff 4 reported he has been
in other restraints with Staff 1 and does not have any concerns with how Staff 1
preforms restraints.
6

Youth B was interviewed via phone on 6/28/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth B reported he does not like Staff 1 due to a recent restraint Staff 1
was involved in with Youth A. Youth B reported he was on the porch of the house
when Youth A was restrained. Youth B reported he saw the whole restraint. Youth
B reported Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were involved in the restraint with
Youth A. Youth B reported Youth A was mad however he did not know why. Youth
A flinched at Staff 1 acting like he was going to hit him and Staff 1 tried to grab
Youth A’s arms. Youth B reported Youth A was resisting and Staff 1 was unable to
get him into a restraint. Youth B reported it was hard for him to explain as there was
a lot happening. Youth B reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 assisted Staff 1 and were
guiding Staff 1 on what to do. Youth B reported he thought it was intentional that
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 went to the ground with Youth A. Youth B reported it was
hard to remember everything. Youth B reported Youth A was able to roll out of the
restraint a few times. Youth B reported he saw Youth A bit Staff 1’s right arm and
Staff 1 punched Youth A in the hairline area of his head to get Youth A to release the
bite. Youth B reported he saw Staff 1 punch Youth A twice with a closed fist. Youth
B reported Staff 1 did not use his elbow or forearm. Youth B reported Staff 1 then
put his knee on Youth A’s neck with his weight on Youth A’s neck. Youth B reported
it lasted long enough for him to notice what was happening however he was unable
to put a specific amount of time on it. Youth B reported he thinks Staff 1 was
repositioning in the restraint. Youth B reported when Staff 4 arrived he transitioned
Staff 1 out of the restraint and Staff 1 took all the other youth back into the house.
Youth B reported a sheriff came to the house that night and talked to staff but did not
talk to him. Youth B reported Administrator 2 got a statement from him that night.
Youth B reported that he had no concerns with Staff 2, Staff 3, or Staff 4 in the
restraint. Youth B reported he did not have any concerns with Staff 1 prior to this
restraint.
Youth C was interviewed via phone on 6/28/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth C reported he witnessed the first part of the restraint that occurred
with Youth A. Youth C reported Youth A was restrained in front of the gym around 6
or 7pm. Youth C reported Youth A became upset in the car ride back to the facility
but did not know why. Youth C reported Youth A moved towards Staff 1 as he was
going to hit Staff 1. Youth C reported Staff 1 then restrained Youth A. Youth C
reported Staff 1 had Youth A’s right arm and Staff 2 came and assisted and had
Youth A’s left arm. Youth C reported he did not see how Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth A
fell to the ground. Youth C reported Staff 3 assisted with Youth A's legs. Youth C did
not see Youth A get hit or Youth A bite Staff 1. Youth C reported he could not see
what was going on as staff were on top of Youth A. Youth A reported Staff 1 had his
elbow on Youth A’s neck and Staff 3 told Staff 1 to move his elbow. Youth C
reported Staff 4 came to assist and took over for Staff 3 on the legs. Youth C
reported Staff 3 took him into the house. Youth C reported he did not see Staff 1’s
elbow on Youth A’s neck however had heard about it. Youth C reported staff and
youth have been talking about the restraint and he has heard the conversations.
Youth C reported Youth A had a red mark on his neck and no other injuries on his
7

face and some scraps on his elbows. Youth C reported Staff 1 had a little blood on
his arm. Youth C reported he has seen Staff 1 in restraints prior and does not have
any concerns with Staff 1.
Youth D was interviewed via phone on 6/28/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth D reported he does not like Staff 1 as Staff 1 messes around and it
irritates him sometimes. Youth D reported he saw the restraint with Youth A. Youth
D reported Youth A was cussing out Staff 1 in the car on the way back from
swimming. Youth D reported Staff 1 was explaining to Youth A that he needed to
follow the rules. Youth D reported Youth A was misbehaving and got restrained.
Youth D was unable to remember specific details of the restraint and what staff were
where in the restraint. Youth D reported Youth A bite Staff 1 and Staff 1 told him not
to bit. Youth D reported Staff 1 was trying to get Youth A’s mouth off his arm. Youth
D reported Staff 1 punched Youth A one time with his elbow to get him to release the
bite. Youth D reported Youth A had a small cut near his eyebrow from the pavement
he was on during the restraint.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 informed him
that he used his right forearm and rammed it into Youth A’s jaw to get Youth A to
release from biting him. Administrator 1 reported this is not a trained technique per
the Safe Crisis Management model. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 informed him
that Staff 1 was unable to feed the bite as trained in the Safe Crisis Management
model and that Staff 1 did not think about using his knuckles to push into Youth A’s
jaw as trained in the Safe Crisis Management model. Administrator 1 reported Staff
1 was not trying to hurt Youth A. Administrator 1 reported he will be doing more
training with staff regarding balance during restraints and bite releases.
Administrator 1 reported he is a trainer in the Safe Crisis Management model and
per the model if balance is lost, staff are trained to regain their balance and get back
into intended position.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video was unable to be viewed due to the incident occurring in the parking lot of the
recreation building where there are no outdoor cameras.
Documents Reviewed:
 Incident report number 137790203 dated 6/18/2022 stated Youth A approached
Staff 1 wanting to fight. Youth A had his hand raised in fighting stance and was
flinching as he was going to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 initiated a single person standing
upper torso assist however was having difficulty due to Youth A struggling. Staff
2 assisted and secured Youth A’s right arm while Staff 1 had Youth A’s left arm.
Youth A was struggling and lost balance causing all three to fall to the ground.
Youth A fell on his side at which time Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to transition to
a side assist hold. Staff 1 was in a squatting position and was attempting to get
8

his knees on the ground while Youth A was moving his head back and forth.
Staff 1 put his knee down making contact with Youth A’s ear/neck area
momentarily. Youth A began spiting at Staff 1. Staff 1 placed his forearm in post
position to avoid the spitting. Youth A then bit Staff 1’s left bicep. Staff 1 thrust
his right forearm into Youth A’s jaw to stop him from biting.
 Physical Management report dated 6/18/2022 authored by Staff 1 which was
consistent with staff interviews.
 Physical Management report dated 6/18/2022 authored by Staff 2 which was
consistent with staff interviews.
 Physical Management report dated 6/18/2022 authored by Staff 3 which was
consistent with staff interviews.
 Osceola County Sheriff’s Office written statement by Staff 1 dated 6/18/2022
which was consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
 Pineview Homes Resident Restraint policy states a resident shall only be
restrained to prevent serious injury to the child, self-injury, or injury to others.
 Bite Escapes per Safe Crisis Management model states to push the part further
into the biter’s mouth to get close to the jaw hinge to neutralize the bite. Place
the middle knuckle of the middle finger against the individuals jaw hinge, rotate
the knuckle into the hinge, as the individual opens their mouth, remove the body
part.
 Pineview Homes Behavioral Support and Management Policy states Safe Crisis
Management philosophy, training and practices shall be utilized when engaging
residents in behavior management situations. All direct care and appropriate
administrative staff shall be trained annually in an approved restraint training
class taught by a certified trainer. Additional training is also given throughout the
year at monthly house meetings. These trainings will provide sufficient and
adequate training for all staff members of the CCI who may use or order the use
of restraint using Pineview’s written procedures. Pineview Homes prohibits the
use of behavior management interventions by any person other than trained,
qualified personnel
 Osceola County Sheriff’s Office Report 67-2200983 which was consistent with
interviews. Staff 1 reported he used his right forearm to make contact with Youth
A’s jaw to get him to release from biting him.
 Staff 1’s personnel file: There were no disciplinary records related to restraints
and Staff 1 completed the required Safe Crisis Management training on 5/9/2022
however did not certify until 6/24/2022. Staff 1 was previously certified in Safe
Crisis Management 5/11/2021.
 Staff 2’s and Staff 3’s personnel file: There were no disciplinary records and Staff
2 and Staff 3 completed the required Safe Crisis Management training on
6/9/2022.
 Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 4 completed
the required Safe Crisis Management training on 5/9/2022.
9

 Youth A’ s file history documents a pattern of Youth A not listening to staff
directions, arguing with staff, and making threats however not acting on the
threats while at the facility. Youth A has been restrained three times since at the
facility. This is the second incident where Youth A attempted to hit staff/ acted as
he was going to hit staff. Youth A became physically aggressive with a peer by
pushing his peer in a previous incident.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 used his
forearm to hit Youth A in the jaw in order to get Youth A to
release from biting Staff 1’s arm. This is not an approved
method per Safe Crisis Management Model.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
All staff should be trained and certified annually to ensure the
staff have been fully trained and are certified to complete
restraints.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
DCWL consultant was not notified within 24 hours of law enforcement being at the
facility.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/22/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator 1 reported Administrator 2 was
on-call Saturday night and responded to the facility to assist. Administrator 1
reported Administrator 2 missed notifying DCWL of law enforcement being at the
facility on Saturday night. Administrator 1 reported he contacted the assigned DCWL
consultant Monday and left a voicemail notifying of the incident. Administrator 1
reported he is aware that the facility was outside the policy requirement of notifying
the assigned DCWL consultant within 24 hours.
Consultant 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/21/2022. Consultant 1 reported
she was not notified by the facility that law enforcement involvement occurred within
10

the 24-hour requirement. Consultant 1 reported she received a voicemail from the
facility on 6/20/2022 asking for a return call. Consultant 1 reported she was in
communication with Administrator 1 on 6/21/2022 and was informed law
enforcement had been at the facility on 6/18/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4150 Incident reporting.
(4) When a resident's behavior results in contact with law
enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the
parent/legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and the
licensing authority as soon as possible, but not more than
24 hours after the incident.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as the DCWL assigned
consultant was not notified that law enforcement had been at
the facility on 6/18/2022 until 6/21/2022.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to the
license status of this child caring institution.
